title: Berkshire live: Tuesday 20 December - BBC News
summary: the defence committee has warned plans to cut funding at bbc monitoring ( bbcm ) will put intelligence gathering at risk .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for joining us again today .
we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 with all berkshire 's latest news , travel , weather and sport .
stay in touch via our facebook and twitter pages .

documents.title: berkshire 's latest headlines
text: berkshire 's latest headlines

documents.title: first section of new a33 bus lane opens
text: the first stretch of the a33 bus lane in reading has opened to buses for the first time today .
gas-powered greenwave buses are now using the first completed section of the new bus lane which is being built on the southbound strip of the a33 .
the a33 is one of reading 's key commuter routes , running from the town centre south to green park business park , the m4 motorway junction and then further south .

documents.title: two men convicted of death by dangerous driving after slough collision
text: two men have been convicted of causing death by dangerous driving following a fatal road traffic collision in slough .
amar waqar , 23 , of queens court , slough , was sentenced to seven years ' imprisonment on friday after being found guilty following an 11-day trial at reading crown court .
arslen shoukat , aged 33 , of st paul 's avenue , slough , was sentenced to four years ' imprisonment at the same hearing .
he pleaded guilty to causing death by dangerous driving at the same court at a hearing in june .
at around 14.30 gmt on 7 december 2015 waqar was driving his purple audi tt quattro and shoukat was driving his white bmw 5 series on bath road at more than twice the speed limit .
the audi tt quattro struck the front offside of a volvo , which was turning out of ipswich road .
the white bmw then struck the central offside of the volvo .
the driver of the volvo , 62-year-old peter mackrory from windsor , died at the scene .
waqar and shoukat were charged on 17 may in connection with the offences .

documents.title: the future of bbc monitoring
text: the commons defence committee have recommended the government should take back funding of the bbc 's monitoring service , which is based in caversham .
radio berkshire 's andrew peach discussed the decision with chatam house 's keir giles , who used to work for the organisation .

documents.title: decision on controversial school to be made tonight
text: a decision will be made on revised plans for a controversial new school on playing fields near reading this evening .

reading borough council - acting as trustees of mapledurham playing fields - will decide whether to sell off part of the land so that the heights free school can move there from temporary buildings in caversham .
the education funding authority is offering the council £ 1.36m for the land and said it needs a smaller plot than first thought .
campaigners had vowed to take legal action to prevent the school from being built at the site .
see the full report ahead of this evening 's meeting here .
author: Tara Maxwell
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

documents.title: drink and drug-driving crackdown results in 142 arrests
text: a crackdown on drink and drug-driving has seen 142 people arrested in the thames valley since the start of the month .
the force are conducting additional patrols in the build up to christmas and breathalysing every motorist involved in a collision .
thames valley police said anyone caught will `` face serious consequences '' .
read more details here .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC Berkshire Online

documents.title: a christmas tree you can read
text: pop into lower earley library and see their wonderful christmas book tree !
@ twitterid

documents.title: fighting to stay put in their bungalow
text: their bungalow is at risk of being demolished , but an elderly couple from newbury are fighting to stay put .
residents of hutton close have been told their housing must be rebuilt by the social housing group sovereign house .
wendy and graham hillyer are among a handful of residents determined to stop the demolition of their homes .

documents.title: where does our love of chocolate come from ?
text: we have a very special relationship with chocolate , and one thing 's for sure , there 'll be plenty consumed over the festive period .
but were does this craving come from ?
the university of reading 's dr ruth salter told bbc radio berkshire 's sarah walker more about its history .

documents.title: berkshire 's latest weather
text: the bright spells we 've been enjoying are expected to give way to cloudier conditions by late afternoon .
however , it is forecast to remain mostly dry before a rainy start to tomorrow .
see a full five-day forecast here .

documents.title: slough gets £ 1m to help those with learning difficulties
text: slough borough council will receive a share of £ 1.3m pounds of government funding to help with housing and technology for people with learning disabilities .

the money , from the department of health , is to be used to improve the quality of life of people with learning disabilities - giving them independence and helping them to feel part of the community .
author: Tara Maxwell
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

documents.title: your christmas cooking questions answered
text: your christmas cooking questions answered

documents.title: new mp pledges to fight heathrow runway plans
text: the winner of the by-election triggered by the proposed expansion of heathrow airport has pledged to continue the fight against a third runway .
liberal democrat sarah olney took the west london seat of richmond park from its former mp zac goldsmith earlier this month .

and during her maiden speech last night , she said : `` the claimed economic benefits of expansion will not compensate for the impacts of the increased noise and air pollution that millions will suffer if expansion goes ahead . ''
mr goldsmith stood as an independent after resigning from the conservatives in protest over the government 's plans for heathrow .
the government has said a new runway will benefit passengers and boost the wider economy .

documents.title: cat breeder disqualified after 64 bengal cats are left to suffer
text: a cat breeder has been disqualified from keeping animals for three years after being found guilty of neglecting more than 60 cats in her care .
elizabeth watson of owlsdene bengals , half acre , bix , appeared at reading magistrates ' court on friday .

she was found guilty of offences under the animal welfare act of failing to protect 64 bengal cats in her care because of a lack of disease control programme and appropriate hygiene provisions to prevent the spread of disease .
the rspca visited the address in february after concerns were raised about the welfare of a number of cats bred to sell .
three were so poorly that they had to be put to sleep .
watson was also sentenced to a 12-week prison sentence , suspended for 12 months , and 60 hours unpaid work .
she was fined a £ 115 victim surcharge and ordered to pay £ 10,000 costs .
when we arrived there were lots and lots of cats just roaming the house and the outbuildings which had been built for breeding in completely unhygienic conditions .
it was chaotic with clutter and rubbish .
many of them were quite unwell with a number suffering from cat flu and eye infections .
author: Sarah Lee
South Online

documents.title: appeal after man assaulted in windsor
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a man in his 40s was hit in the head by two men in windsor .
the incident took place on sunday , 11 december at about 02.30 gmt in thames street , close to the junction with cloisters .
the victim was hit in the head by two unknown men , sustaining injuries .
he was taken to wexham park hospital for treatment and has since been discharged .

documents.title: sonning church hall damaged after electrical fire
text: firefighters were called to a fire at a church hall in sonning on monday .
three fire crews attended the blaze at around 11:30 gmt at the back of st andrew 's church in thames street .
the cause of the fire is believed to be an electrical fault .
white watch deal with a fire in a church hall in sonning .
2 ba wearers , ppv and fire extinguishers were used to extinguish the fire .
i am the architect and would like to help the investigation in any way i can
author: Sarah Lee
South Online

documents.title: queen to step down as patron of 25 charities
text: the queen will step down as patron of 25 national organisations at the end of her 90th birthday year , says buckingham palace .
the patronages , including the nspcc , save the children , barnardo 's and battersea dog 's home , will be passed on to other members of the royal family .
rugby football union and the royal geographical society are also affected .
the queen is royal patron of more than 600 bodies - 433 of which she has been patron of since 1952 .

text: south west trains spread some festive cheer

it was scored over the weekend as maidenhead beat dartford 5-0 .
it 's even been posted by an italian fan account of british football .

documents.title: concern over man missing from hospital
text: police are continuing to appeal for the public 's help to find a man missing from hospital .
babatunde paul odeyemi , 54 , who lives in kilworth avenue in southend , essex , went missing from newham general hospital , having last been seen at 23:30 gmt on wednesday , 7 december .
he has links to the bracknell , berkshire area .
mr odeyemi had been taken to hospital after being found collapsed earlier that day .
the hospital diagnosed mr odeyemi with a neurological problem causing him to collapse .
when they returned to discuss his results they found he had left the hospital .
he has not been seen or heard from since .
author: Sarah Lee
South Online

documents.title: appeal after elderly woman pushed in distraction burglary
text: police are appealing for witnesses after an elderly woman was robbed in a distraction burglary in slough .
the incident took place at a property in chalvey road east on thursday at about 17:00 gmt .
the victim , an elderly woman , was pushed to the ground after opening her door .
the attacker stole two handbags and walked out of the house .
the offender is white , aged between 50 and 60 and is about 5ft 7ins .
he was wearing a navy blue woollen hat , a black anorak and dark trousers .

documents.title: 'spectacular ' lights in newbury this year
text: @ twitterid # newbury lights are spectacular this year

documents.title: concern over moving bbc monitoring out of caversham park
text: the commons defence committee has expressed particular concern at plans to move monitoring out of its current caversham park headquarters in berkshire , where it operates alongside its us counterpart , open source enterprise ( ose ) , potentially disrupting information-sharing with the americans .
currently , monitoring covers 25 % of the globe , while ose covers the remaining 75 % .
the committee 's findings echo a similar warning earlier this year by the commons foreign affairs committee .
author: Sarah Lee
South Online

documents.title: under 18s to learn about alcohol awareness through 'manga ' comic strips
text: the project is being organised by reading borough council and will be run by reading artist stephanie o'brien .
it 'll give 13-17 year olds the opportunity to create their own 'manga ' style comic books themed around alcohol awareness .
councillors hope it will raise awareness of the dangers of alcohol .
hopefully this will keep a number of young people engaged throughout the holiday period as well as making them aware of health and well-being messages .
over the festive period , o'brien will be running a facebook group to provide updates , drawing guidance and engage youth through competitions .
author: Atif Rashid
BBC News

documents.title: reading fc will spend christmas day in the top three
text: `` i 'm absolutely delighted '' @ georgeevans70 's goal means # readingfc will spend christmas day in the top three .

documents.title: naturists celebrate finding new pool for nude swim sessions
text: a group of reading naturists have said they are relieved to have found a new venue for their nude swimming sessions , after arthur hill swimming pool closed this week .
the reading chronicle reported earlier this month the group was `` furious '' at the council 's decision to close the pool .
now reading naturist group 's treasurer mark young said the council had been `` very good '' and found them a new slot at the meadway centre .
sessions will take place on friday evenings in the new year .

mr young said he hoped the group would attract more members to its 30-strong group as the new pool hire was slightly more expensive ( £ 80 per session ) compared to the arthur hill pool hire ( around £ 60 ) .

documents.title: reading mp calls for re-think on bbc monitoring cuts
text: reading east mp rob wilson has been talking to bbc radio berkshire about the findings of the commons defence committee , published on monday .
`` firstly it 's very important to confirm that bbc monitoring is an indispensable resource .
`` i 'm really worried about how the bbc is going about it , slashing 100 jobs , cutting £ 4m from their budget .
this is going to diminish the capability of the organisation to undertake the vital work that it does .

`` i am very keen to make sure the intelligence we up from this open source monitoring and the co-operation with our american counterparts continues and it continues at caversham park because it is clearly an indispensable resource to the country . ''

documents.title: who owns caversham park , the home to bbc monitoring ?
text: it 's not clear who owns caversham park , where bbc monitoring is based .

according to a report by the commons defence committee : `` the estate was purchased with public money supplied on the basis that caversham would be used for monitoring foreign broadcasts on behalf of government departments and agencies . ''
the committee says it questions

there will still be some mist and cloud around in patches .
it will be chilly , with temperatures hovering around 7c .

documents.title: caversham-based bbc monitoring in danger of becoming a 'hollow shell '
text: monitoring , the uk service based in caversham that translates and analyses global media , is in danger of becoming a `` hollow shell '' , mps have warned .
the government has moved responsibility for its funding to the bbc , which the defence committee said had `` entirely predictably '' led to cuts .
it added that bbc monitoring was `` vital '' to diplomacy and business .
the bbc said it was `` confident '' the service would continue to meet the uk government 's needs .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: sunshine forecast for this afternoon
text: morning , a cloudy start to the day but sunny spells expected this afternoon .
we 'll be keeping you updated throughout the day with the latest weather , travel and news from berkshire on our live news service .
you can stay in touch on our twitter and facebook pages .
author: Emma Midgley
